reviewText: We had ordered a vitamix blender in 2012.  We regarded it highly but are now very skeptical about the ethics of this company.  We have recently received a class action invitation and only then became aware about Vitamix blenders shedding TEFLON each time when you run them.  I was pretty upset because rather than reaching out to former clients IMMEDIATELY upon knowing the issue - Vitamix just hoped it would disappear until they got sued.  I would never, never again buy a product from Vitamix.  We avoid in our household all kinds of Teflon material and learning that the very piece of equipment that we bought for health was actually adding Teflon in diet for years - was a very nasty surprise.  Apparently they fixed the issue in 2015 and they did not bother to contact all their customers to offer free replacement.  While currently Teflon seems to be OK we don't know what new discoveries will be made.  For now, we are sending (we contacted recently and they offered to replace the seals in our containers) what we have back and unwillingly probably will use it occasionally.  This whole issue (in my view) was a profits over health or at least customer satisfaction issue.  On more uses I can also say that cleaning this item is a hassle.  The 48 oz container is hard to reach and fit in most sinks.  We got recently a german brand - that is glass, has no teflon and while less powerful it seems to be OK for ordinary use.  If you need to make blended food for medical reasons make especially sure that you have a new container from Vitamix that does not infuse Teflon to your diet.
summary: Years of Teflon exposure - thanks to Vitamix.

We recently moved into a house, a rental, that I'm not allowed to permanently update or change. Our entire bathroom is painted in a "burnt umber" color, and it has a lovely matching paisley shower curtain.

Anyway, this is a review of the "Avanti Linens 017892COP Bradford Hand Towel, Medium, Copper" hand towel. As you can see, it is embellished with a lovely paisley edgework, and the terrycloth part is a vibrant burnt-umber color. So now our bathroom looks like it was literally designed AROUND this hand towel.

Our bathroom didn't really have a preexisting hand towel "fixture," either, so we additionally purchased a hand-towel bar that is fake brushed nickel and sticks to the wall with Command strips (five-star review forthcoming). Folded once lengthwise and tossed over the bar, this hand towel fits our impermanent towel rod absolutely perfectly!

I purchased two hand towels to start, but I think I'd like to pick up more, in case this towel ever suddenly disappears from Amazon. It was a very good purchase, and I'm really excited I found it.

I would warn, however, that after a single washing the towel looks a little bit dull and ragged, with a few dangling threads, and overall looking not quite as grand as it initially did. In the future, I will probably throw this hand towel, or one like it, into a mesh bra bag before washing, in order to preserve its too-fleeting elegance. At US$18 I wish this towel had held up a teensy bit better but, seeing as I don't live in Buckingham Palace, it's pretty all right.
summary: It was literally the exact thing I was looking for

reviewText: I love my Instapot. Im on Dr Gundrys low lectin diet (see youtube if you have health challenges) and more meals go in the pressure cooker than dont. The 8 quart plus a frying pan of extra veggies and greens makes about 6 meals for 3 big eater adults. I start soups and stews with 2 sliced onions on Saut for 20 min while cutting veggies. When done I just add the veggies and frozen chicken thighs or fresh ground turkey or whatever, a small tomato paste, a quart of chicken or bone broth, spices, press the stew/meat button and end up with a delicious soup/stew. Here's my take on the whistling controversy - I just made my first pot of coffee this morning.  I filled it up past the holes that feed water into the spout.  It was more water than I needed, but I wanted to follow instructions.  I put the top on and pushed it down to snap it into place. It heated up and started boiling in a reasonable amount of time.  It started whistling loudly, with a two-tone, loud, but not unpleasant sound.

It had been heating up long enough to make the handle too hot to pick it up with.  I'd had the gas burner on full-blast, so this didn't surprise me.  I poured out the water into my coffee container to let it steep.  There was still a fair amount of water in it, so I decided to put it back on the flame and see if it whistled with a smaller amount of water.  The cover on the spout is a small, hinged cover that's held in place by gravity.  I figured that the steam pressure would vent up the spout, and stop the whistle from happening.  As it started boiling, I noticed steam coming out the spout, but then after a few seconds, the whistle went off, quieter, and without the distinctive notes I'd heard before, but it was there.

So, I think the two things needed for a loud and distinctive whistle are:  Fill it up past the spout-holes, and push the lid on tightly.  And use a hot pad to pick it up.

I make a large, 20 ounce glass of coffee in the morning, and make it last through the day.  This pot is just the right size for my needs. It looks good, seems to be very sturdy, and it works well, from my first use of it.  If anything needs reporting in the future, I'll come back and let you know.
summary: Here's whistling at you, kid - but use a hot pad.

reviewText: Perfect for our needs
Sound, solid and well-engineered...be certain to snap the attachments/corners into place when you are using the butterfly clamps...

PROS:
- it's huge!!!
- heats up within 7 minutes and works great!
- looks sleek
- fair price

CONS and ANNOYANCES:
- 2-PRONG cord: full metal, high wattage appliance with NO ground? safety concern?
- counter-intuitive operations--must read manual to operate effectively
- cannot get convection button to trigger fans--may have to read manual again
- no visual or auditory preheat indicator. Manual states device takes 7 minutes to preheat
- device auto-sets a cook timer of 20 minutes.  factor in 7 minute preheat, which you will have to monitor by means other than convection oven, and it leaves you with 13 minute cook time. So, you will likely have to immediately change the cook time to reflect amount of time needed, plus 7 minutes for preheating.

OVERALL:
Truthfully, you can fit a huge amount of food in this convection oven, it heats up super fast, and it works great.  If they gave it a 3-prong cord, an indicator for when preheating is done, and a few more user friendly interfaces then I would definitely give this a 5 star.

The name of this translates to something like "Everyday Scent." This is the incense regular people burn at their shrines at home in Japan and smells similar to temple incense.

This is a great price compared to boutique brands you might find at Japanese gift shops in the US, and is of good quality if you want a traditional smell. It is infinitely better than the dollar store incense my grandma used to burn, and works out to be about the same price.

The sticks are exactly 5 3/8 inches long and burn for about 25-30 minutes with no draft.

Like all Japanese incense, the whole stick burns--there is no "handle"--so you will need a holder of some type. My box came with an un-stylish square ceramic holder, but it won't catch the ash.
summary: Good quality, traditional scent, value price

reviewText:
Great item! The regular stand that attached to my tv was too large for the width of the console it sat on. (I know ill measure for that next time). Its a 55"  flat screen. putting it together was easy, just be careful not to put the left side with right side parts as they are not marked left or right. So its a guessing game until you figure that out, once you do its easy peasy!
The stand is made of strong metals, very sturdy I was highly skeptical from an online perspective whether it would hold my TV securely. After attaching it there was no doubt. its a great option to buying a new entertainment unit or wall mounting or for broken stands.

 The legs jut out in front the tv 7" and behind the tv 6" the feet are an L shaped bent metal that attaches to the uprights with 2 bolts on each side. There's another 2 bolts on each side that connects the feet to the tv brackets so 10 pieces total make up the brackets and 16 bolts including the screws that connect the brackets to the TV. Phillips head screws and you'll need a small adjustable wrench. It is a small project to build. It comes with a manifesto of screws all organized to do what you need to do for your situation be somewhat mechanically inclined and turn the screws tightly or get yourself some loctight glue for screws( yes you can unscrew it when it dries). I really like the item it was a great fix to my problem. ships in small 10" X 5" box. I had no problems with shipping 3 day wait for me.
summary: Yes, it will hold your TV securely!!!!

reviewText:
Experienced bakers know that Wilton is a name you can trust. This disposable decorating bag set is no different. Here's what you get:

12-inch bags (24)
16-inch bags (24)
Icing bag ties (12)

The ties are just a type of rubber band that can be reused if you're mindful and remember to save them. If not, you can always just tie off the tops of the bag, but I do really like the security of the rubber ties.

For first time buyers be aware that this set only includes the bags and ties. If you don't already own one, you'll want to purchase a tip set (also available from Wilton), ideally in multiple shapes and sizes.

I tried for a while to use reusable decorating bags, but honestly it's just a mess and the disposable variety objectively work better. And you can't go wrong with Wilton. Highly recommended!

reviewText:
This product was used to provide privacy into garage windows in the hot Nevada sun (East facing).  Tips that others have already mentioned:
1. I used Spray-away glass cleaner to a) clean the glass and b) as the wetting agent. This worked well.
2. I used a small bathroom squeegee to apply the film.  Be sure to remove all bubbles.
3. Cut the film about 1/32" shorter on length and width. This will give you a minimal 1/64" margin all the way around and allow room for the wetting solution to escape while pressing the film in place with the squeegee.
4. If you're getting frustrated, remove the film, re-wet, and start again (making sure you don't get any dirt on the window side of the film.

After a few months, the product has performed as expected with no bubbling or blisters. It looks like frosted glass.  If it deteriorates over time from the sun, I will update my review.

reviewText: Okay, bought this for camping. I usually drink instant coffee when camping alone, because my wife was going I wanted to make her a good cup of coffee in the mornings.  I settled on a french press because of the over a percolator because sometimes if you are not careful you can over percolate coffee too much and end up with sludge.  This french press did a remarkable job, the coffee tastes awesome and she was impressed, winning.  Any case there are a few things I didn't like, the pot was too small, it didn't hold the volume of water needed to make the amount of coffee I drink in the morning. This is no fault of the seller or manufacturer, I should have looked at this before buying it. Second, I use a white gas stove and I found the diameter of the pot to be too small. It was very windy where we camped and with the breeze blowing around the the flame it made poor contact heating up the pot. I should have bought a wider one. Any case the pot is small and fits nicely in my camping gear box. Next time I would by a larger one from Bellemain.

I love this cart, I just finished putting it together and it went smooth as butter. All the pieces were there and all the holes were drilled correctly.
Some pointers if you buy this. 1) You can tell the direction of all 4 drawer sides by looking at the 'rounded edge' of each piece. Also on the drawers, keep the wheel in the track to the outside and to the rear of the drawer. 2) Part "(v)" is hidden in the packing of the top, its wrapped in foam and looks like scrap if you don't look closely. 3) The center "walls" with the drawer slides attached have pegs on the bottom, not the top. and the slides face inward, this should tell you direction for those. Everything else has a different letter designation on it to tell you its position.  I opted not to use the casters on mine after reading several reviews, if you do use them, do yourself a favor and use carriage bolts and washers from the inside through a drilled hole to lock nuts on the caster side. the tiny wood screws they provide for these are what causes the issue with them tearing out. I bought 4" solid wood feet to put on mine  *the casters measure 3 and 3/4 inches from floor to plate. The cart measures 32" with no casters installed. I also chose not to install the condiment shelf and towel bar, my application did not have the room for this feature. Fantastic purchase, 5 stars.
summary: Great cart, fits exactly where I wanted it to fill a spot.

reviewText: We love this coffee maker. After having a problem with it clogging, the company sent a new one, and it works perfectly well. Makes great coffee!

Great. Solid build. Unlike some of the reviewers, I wouldn't say this is a heavy weight stock pot. It is not flimsy either, quite the opposite. Solidly build, but light enough to carry when full (I would expect a med-small framed woman to NOT be able to carry it full, and perhaps a medium sized guy might struggle). I really like it. Its walls are thick enough to make it solid, but not too thick to add excess weight (nor act as an unnecessary heat sink when heating its contents). The lid is flat and indented, fitting in, not over the pot (just slightly). This means condensation won't leak out readily. Handles are bolted on, but show no signs of loosening in the several months I've had it. The one thing I wasn't thinking about when I bought it, was how it fit on my gas stove top. It doesn't quite center on the back burners (which I much prefer to use), the distance between the back controls of the over/stove and the burner isn't quite large enough, so it is just slightly off center. Still, that isn't a problem for me (ymmv), and heats evenly and quickly (for a pot of that size). I only give 5 star ratings to things which I view not just as excellent but excellent values. Quite happy with this, I got what I paid for.

I bought both the salt mill and the pepper mill. Both seem fine so far. Nicely finished wood. Grind mechanism works like the manufacturer describes. The only trouble I had was filling the mills with salt crystals or peppercorns.  The grind system is spring loaded so you have to hold the mill and push up on the external grind disc at the same time you are trying to fill the mill.  It can be done but is tricky and makes it had not to spill. Both mills leave a bit of salt or pepper residue underneath when you set them down. Not a big deal and all other mills I have had are the same.  The larger you have set the grind the more the residue.

This is perfect. Brews quickly. While I haven't measured to see how much the pot actually holds and what the measurements on the carafe measure to, I know how to brew to my liking. The instructions say to use two of the scoops (one scoop is a tablespoon) for every 6 ounces water depending on your liking. So far thats been pretty good with the current coffee I have. I just premeasure the water before boiling so I can just pour the whole kettle over it (takes a couple pours since the filter doesnt hold 16oz. I like big coffees.  I have an espresso maker but have wanted to cut back on the mochas and don't have room for a full coffee pot so this is perfectly tiny. Plus the filter can sit on top of my mug and brew directly into my cup, no need to dirty the carafe if Im the only one having coffee. But I mostly purchased this to have a coffee pot while camping. All I need to do is boil water ovee the fire and I have an instant pot of fresh coffee. Love this.
Only thing I didn't like was that there was no packaging in the box to keep the carafe from breaking. No foam or whatever, just the carafe, filter/brewer, scoop and the instructions and paper filters, all in a super thin box. Poor packaging. This came in a larger box with other items so I know there was room for the box to shift around and Im actually really surprised it didn't break.

The Thermos bottles like this one do an excellent job of keeping hot things hot and cold stuff cold. The reason for the low rating is a poorly designed cover. The flip top mechanism sounds good -- convenient for one-handed operation in an automobile cup holder -- however the design is flawed. The seal between cover and cup depends on a soft gasket material that is prone to leaks. The cover itself holds another elastic material that is supposed to plug both the drink flow opening and the vent hold, but that seal is also prone to leaks as it ages. Most problematic is that the flip mechanism is actuated by an elastic that is doomed to fail sooner or later. Mine failed in less than a year. When I contacted Thermos, I was "handled" by a surly customer service rep who said she'd arrange for a replacement cover to be sent to me, but that failure mode was due to fair wear and tear, and I'd have to purchase new caps when (not if) they failed again. I looked to see if I could find a place to purchase them, and could not.
The bottom line is that the cover is poorly designed and sure to fail. I've never had one last a year. There's a big hole in the market for someone who designs a better cap.
summary: Good bottle, but the world is still waiting for a well-designed cap

This is a nice, wool rug at a very reasonable price. The colors are fairly true to the picture although I'd say ours appears a slightly darker overall. It's slightly thinner than some wool rugs I've seen, but still respectably thick and much warmer to stand on than hardwood. The biggest surprise was that our dog (medium sized w/ short hair) loves this. She scratches her back by laying on it and bicycling her feet in the air -- very cute but also pretty hilarious. All this has been going on daily for three months now and, with nothing more than occasional vacuum cleaning, the rug still looks great. I've noticed it slides less than other wool rugs of similar size, but if you were to put it in a high-traffic area (or if you have little kids who haven't yet figured out how rugs can slide) having a rug-pad underneath it would be handy.

reviewText:
My wife and I love everything about this set of glass dinnerware.

The packaging is sufficient, and nothing arrived broken or chipped, even the stoneware mugs.

We had a set of earthware prior to this, and it was thick, bulky, heavy, and it scratched and chipped all of the time.

This Corelle set, is the polar opposite. It's light, thin, sturdy, and it looks beautiful the white is dazzling, and it doesn't get scratched by our flatware. The blue design is a stunning cobalt.

The dinner plate is a perfect size for most meals and fits nicely in our dishwasher. The bread plate is a bit smaller than we are used to, and we don't use it for smaller meals, but they do come in handy. The bowls are an excellent size for cereal, (the separate cereal bowls must be huge!) salads, soup, and chips. I imagine that these bowls might be a little small for people that are used to huge portions. For us, they're perfect. The mugs are a beautiful color and hold just a slight bit more than a cup of liquid.

Seriously, for the price and durability, you can't go wrong. We bought 2 sets!
summary: The perfect set for our suburban life.

reviewText:
I like it as far as how hot it gets, but will return it because of the auto-off feature.

I need an iron for stitchery projects.  I tested this one for less than 10 minutes and noticed immediately that the sliding temperature selector does not go high enough to select linen without using both thumbs and more pressure than the other settings need.  It did get hot enough for ironing the cotton fabric.

However, there is still the problem of the auto shut off feature.  It is very inadequately described on the Amazon web page.  I did not want one that shut off after a few seconds when the iron is in the ironing (flat) position.  I used to iron to make a little extra money.  When I had family at home, sometimes ironing would take a few hours.  (Admittedly, that was 'back in the day' when ironing was customary.)  Those activities can't be efficiently and calmly done when you have to restart the iron frequently.  What if you are ironing long or wide items and need more than a few seconds?  What if an embroidery transfer needs more time?  What if you make quilts and need to go back and forth from sewing to ironing?  My last iron shut off after a few seconds and made ironing a misery, so I threw it away.

The instructions for this iron do not fully describe the auto-off function so I am not sure if it turns off after 10 seconds, 30 seconds, or some other length of time when it is in the flat position; however, the included instructions say "Timed auto-off will automatically turn unit off after 30 minutes."  That takes care of the questions I just asked:  It doesn't matter how long you *need* to iron or whether you move the iron from flat to upright.  You are only allowed 30 minutes.  The Sunbeam webpage description and a chat with a nice woman at Sunbeam confirm that.  Having to regularly turn the iron back on is not acceptable.

The instructions go on to say "3-way auto-off (15 min in heeled position)."  And that is all.

Basically, the instructions say that 1) the iron will shut off regardless of activity in 30 minutes, 2) it will shut off in 15 minutes when left in the upright position, and 3) will shut off at some point for some undefined reason.

I will continue to research irons and will find one without the auto-off feature.
it was all good and comfy

It's quite roomy and fits a lot on it.  My only wish is that the cloth pad dried up a little more quickly.  It can stay wet for days, even without dishes on it.  It seems mold and odor resistant so it's not too big a deal overall.  Sometimes I drape it on a towel rod to help it dry out.  Overall though, I like it and would purchase it again.
summary: Good overall but wish it dried faster
